FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA ON)

_prev_prog_3.Description: The facility uses an ammonia refrigeration system

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Lone Star Cold Storage operates as a cold storage refrigerated warehouse for food products used for human consumption.  The facility is located at 401 North Grove, Richardson, Texas 75081.  The SIC code for the operation is 4222; the NAICS code is 49312.  The facility has approximately 15 full time employees.  The facility typically operates 12 hours per day, six days per week, 52 weeks per year.  Staffing is greater during normal business hours due to the presence of management and administrative personnel.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

The facility has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program (PSM) in accordance with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standard, 29 CFR 1910.119 as their accidental release prevention program.  The system is continuously monitored by computer based controls that alert technicians that are trained, qualified, and experienced in ammonia refrigeration in accordance with the facility?s PSM program.  The system is visually inspected periodically for proper operation daily.  System parameters are logged in a permanent record, as are routine maintenance activities.  Safe operation of the system will be accomplished by utilizing general good operating procedures and providing appropriate training to employees.

This facility has developed and implemented a written Emergency Action Plan as defined in 
29 CFR 1910.38 as their emergency response program.  This facility will utilize outside agencies and/or organizations to perform emergency response measures in the event of a fire, explosion or hazardous material release.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:

This facility operates as a cold storage warehouse with approximately 60,000 square feet of refrigerated space.  The facility utilizes an ammonia refrigeration system to keep products at storage temperature and preserve food safety standards.  The major components of the ammonia

system are located in the mechanical room.  The system is a one stage economized refrigeration cycle.  Support operations include a maintenance shop, forklift area, and administrative offices.

Anhydrous ammonia is listed as a hazardous chemical subject to the RMP regulation with a threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.  The operating capacity of the system exceeds this threshold.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical ? Specific Prevention Steps:

This facility complies with the provisions of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration?s Process Safety Management Program 29 CFR 1910.119 and the Environmental Protection Agency?s Risk Management Program 40 CFR 68.  The facility?s PSM program includes provisions for process hazard analyses, management of change, pre-start up safety reviews, safe work, practices, inspections, testing, maintenance, compliance audits, and contractor qualifications.  Qualified outside contractors are used for construction and major repairs or modifications to the system.  The PSM program is reviewed annually and updated as necessary.  All significant changes to the system are reviewed in accordance with the PSM/RMP management of change provisions stated in the facility?s plan.

The system is equipped with a series of redundant fail safe devices, sensors, and overides.  In the event a malfunction occurs that could result in an ammonia release, these protective devices shut the system down.  The system can?t be restarted until the cause of the shutdown is identified and corrected.  The system is equipped with ammonia detectors that alarm and start local exhaust ventilation system when the presence of ammonia is sensed above set point levels in the engine room.  The system can be manually shutdown using a kill switch located outside the engine room.

Five Year Accident History

There is no reportable accident history since this is an initial startup.

Emergency Response Program

The facility has made arrangements wit

h the local fire department and outside contractors to respond to emergencies involving anhydrous ammonia.  The facility conducts periodic drills.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The facility will upgrade and update safety programs as warranted or needed.

Lone Star Cold Storage has complied with the requirements of section 302 and 303 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act (EPCRA) by notifying the State Emergency Response Commission (SERC), the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), and the Fire Department of the presence of ammonia at the site.  The facility files a Tier 2 Chemical Inventory each year with the SERC, LEPC and the Fire Department as required by sections 311 and 312 of EPCRA.  The facility's emergency action plan includes procedures for notifying the proper agencies in the event of a reportable release of ammonia.  A release of 100 pounds or more must be reported to the National Response Center, the SERC, and LEPC, in accordance with section 304 of EPCRA.  The Fire Department has been provided with a copy of the facility's emergency action plan.
